author: DarwinJS
body:
# Support Question

Sorry - I don't know how to touch bases with everyone who gets on the calls.

I can't find that windows tar has built binaries available anywhere publicly.  Does anyone know where they might be?

If they truly aren't built anywhere, does anyone know if the Free for Open Source Azure Pipelines could be configured to build it?  (https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/announcing-azure-pipelines-with-unlimited-ci-cd-minutes-for-open-source/)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Found the internal owner will see if they respond.  Since it's the end of year, might not hear back til next year.

comments.author: DarwinJS
comments.body: I forgot to mention that after posting this issue, I opened an issue on the github page for the project and asked if they distribute binaries - they answered no and closed the issue.  Not sure if the internal person is the same as the repo owner.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @DarwinJS it's likely the same person.  What is the repo?

comments.author: DarwinJS
comments.body:
https://github.com/libarchive/libarchive/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed
Fyi,
D

On Sat, Dec 22, 2018, 4:18 PM Steve Lee <notifications@github.com wrote:

> @DarwinJS <https://github.com/DarwinJS> it's likely the same person. What
> is the repo?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/8499#issuecomment-449598165>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ALD1hhjdXO1IcOuG4IGstuN8l5TWeRFrks5u7qG2gaJpZM4ZcvkY>
> .
>

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Thanks @DarwinJS that doesn't look like a Microsoft owned repo but the repo for the original source and I don't expect they would build/maintain binaries.

comments.author: DarwinJS
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT - is it possible to get the compile settings and/or CI job config that Microsoft is using to compile the built-in version?  For instance, I noticed 7zip format is not included in the one that ships on Windows.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Unfortunately not able to get that information

title: Getting Windows Tar Packaged
